p: Other well recognized factors accounting for this elevated risk include a low hemoglobin, low BMI, and increasing age [ 16, 19â€“ 22]. Low BMI is a strong independent predictor of mortality among HIV infected individuals even in the context of ART initiation [ 23], with higher BMI levels associated with a protective effect on both mortality and incident TB estimates [ 23, 24]. HIV-infected individuals are therefore likely to benefit from micronutrient supplementation, although there have been conflicting reports of their effect on HIV-related co-morbidities or mortality [ 25]. Similarly, determinants for TB among HIV-infected patients vary across settings [ 26].
